item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, April 12, 2025 at 6:20 AM UTC
item.description:
1. $70M in 60 Seconds: How Insider Info Helped Someone 28x Their Money (102 points | 18 comments)
2. Rust to C compiler – 95.9% test pass rate, odd platforms (68 points | 10 comments)
3. Google Is Winning on Every AI Front (36 points | 13 comments)
4. You might not need WebSockets (213 points | 142 comments)
5. Vacheron Constantin breaks the world record for most complicated wristwatch (156 points | 119 comments)
6. Fedora change aims for 99% package reproducibility (337 points | 165 comments)
7. Intentionally Making Close Friends (2021) (170 points | 20 comments)
8. A 32-bit processor made with an atomically thin semiconductor (171 points | 34 comments)
9. Adobe deletes Bluesky posts after backlash (295 points | 389 comments)
10. Erlang's not about lightweight processes and message passing (2023) (236 points | 131 comments)
11. Once lush Sahara was home to a surprisingly unique group of humans (95 points | 14 comments)
12. Blue Prince is a roguelike puzzle masterpiece (126 points | 75 comments)
13. Show HN: Omiword – A daily, sector-based word puzzle (38 points | 26 comments)
14. Soil from the moon's far side suggests drier conditions than side facing Earth (12 points | 1 comment)
15. Germany creates 'super–high-tech ministry' for research, technology, aerospace (176 points | 176 comments)
16. Datastar: Web Framework for the Future? (197 points | 106 comments)
17. Every picture from Venus' surface, ever (2021) (15 points | discuss)
18. Bonobos use a kind of syntax once thought to be unique to humans (148 points | 102 comments)
19. Lead is still bad for your brain (155 points | 137 comments)
20. Windows 2000 Server named peak Microsoft (136 points | 189 comments)
21. AI Coding and the Peanut Butter and Jelly Problem (74 points | 43 comments)
22. But what if I want a faster horse? (1261 points | 544 comments)
23. Bilinear interpolation on a quadrilateral using Barycentric coordinates (114 points | 28 comments)
24. Leaked data reveals Israeli govt campaign to remove pro-Palestine posts on Meta (805 points | 502 comments)
25. Key principles on in-game virtual currencies in the EU (52 points | 36 comments)
26. Strengths Are Your Weaknesses (309 points | 97 comments)
27. In Guatemala, painted altar found at Tikal adds new context to Maya history (12 points | 4 comments)
28. WebRTC for the Curious (120 points | 28 comments)
29. A recent study suggests that insects branched out from crustaceans (83 points | 81 comments)
30. Modern 6502 (88 points | 7 comments)
